startPage.title: Assessment
startPage.content:
Congratulations on completing the course!


Click Start to take the assessment and see how much you have learned.


In order to receive CPE credit, you must score a 70% of higher on this assessment. The assessment includes a series of multiple-choice questions. You will be provided consolidated feedback at the end of the assessment. Feel free to review the course content before you begin the assessment.


Good luck!!
startPage.successText: Congratulations! You have completed this assessment with a score of

PassText.congratsText:
Congratulations! You have successfully completed this assessment and will receive CPE credit.

Your assessment results are shown below.
PassText.InstructionText: Click on the EXIT button to exit this course and return to the main menu.

FailText.FailSubTitle:
Your score is not sufficient to earn you CPE credit points.

Your assessment results are shown below.

Retake.RetakeInstructionText: Click Retake Assessment to reattempt the assessment, or click Exit to exit this course and return to the main menu.

FailText.infoText: You may close this window to revisit the course.

resultPage.AssessmentCloseText:
Your assessment progress will be lost and you will have to restart from the beginning.

Do you really want to close the assessment?

body.question: Which of the following is within the scope of IFRS 9?
body.instruction: Check the correct option and select Submit.

choice.cdata-section: Contracts to purchase a non-financial item for speculative purposes that is readily convertible to cash
Employer rights and obligations under defined benefit plans
Equity instruments issued by the entity
Rights and obligations under insurance contracts

body.question: Which of the following is fully within the scope of IFRS 9?
body.instruction: Check the correct option and select Submit.

choice.cdata-section: Loan commitments that the entity does not designate as financial liabilities at fair value through profit or loss
Forward contract between an acquirer and a selling shareholder that will result in a business combination
A commitment to provide a loan at below-market interest rate
Employer rights and obligations under defined contribution plans

body.question: Which of the following is fully within the scope of IFRS 9?
body.instruction: Check the correct option and select Submit.

choice.cdata-section: Insurance contracts
Loan commitments at market rate interest
Forward contracts with a financial underlying
Leasing rights and obligations

body.question: Which of the following is an example of an underlying?
body.instruction: Check the correct option and select Submit.

choice.cdata-section: Tons of steel
GBP 1 million
1,000 shares
90-day LIBOR rate

body.question: Which of the following are exempt from derivative treatment under IFRS 9?
body.instruction: Check the correct option and select Submit.

choice.cdata-section: Forward contracts requiring net settlement
Regular way contracts
Embedded derivatives in lease contracts
Credit default swaps

body.question: Which of the following best describes an embedded derivative?
body.instruction: Check the correct option and select Submit.

choice.cdata-section: A contract that includes both a non-derivative host contract and one or more embedded derivatives

A financial instrument that causes modifications to some or all of the cash flows that would otherwise be required by the contract, according to a specified financial variable or non-financial variable that is not specific to a party to the contract
A financial instrument, whose value changes in response to a variable, requires no initial or minimal net investment, and is settled at a future date
A contract entered into held for the purpose of the receipt or delivery of a non-financial item in accordance with the entity's expected purchase, sale, or usage requirements

body.question: When are contracts to buy or sell a non-financial item accounted for as derivatives?
body.instruction: Check the correct option and select Submit.

choice.cdata-section: When they are 'net settled' in accordance with the IFRS 9 definition and do not meet the own use exemption
When they are not 'net settled' in accordance with the IFRS 9 definition and do not meet the own use exemption
When they are not 'net settled' in accordance with the IFRS 9 definition and meet the own use exemption
When they are 'net settled' in accordance with the IFRS 9 definition and meet the own use exemption

body.question: Which of the following contracts could qualify for the own use exemption under IFRS 9?
body.instruction: Check the correct option and select Submit.

choice.cdata-section: A foreign currency forward contract
A forward to purchase copper
An option to sell shares of a public entity
A fixed-for-variable rate interest swap

body.question: To which of the following could the own use exemption apply?
body.instruction: Check the correct option and select Submit.

choice.cdata-section: Contracts to buy or sell a foreign currency
Contracts to buy or sell natural gas
Contracts to buy or sell entity's own shares
Contracts to buy or sell shares of a public entity

body.question: Which of the following embedded derivatives are considered closely related to the host contract?
body.instruction: Check the correct option and select Submit.

choice.cdata-section: Embedded derivative in an equity contract related to the share price of a third-party
Embedded derivative in a debt instrument related to the credit risk of a party other than issuer
Embedded derivative in a debt instrument related to the creditworthiness of the issuer
Embedded derivative in a lease contract related to an inflation index of a foreign country

body.question: In which of the following situations will an embedded derivative be separated from its host contract?
body.instruction: Check the correct option and select Submit.

choice.cdata-section: The embedded derivative is closely related to the economic characteristics of the host.
The host is a debt security classified as at fair value through profit or loss.
The host instrument is a financial asset in the scope of IFRS 9.
The embedded derivative would be accounted for as a derivative if it were freestanding and it is not closely related to the economic characteristics of the host.

body.question: Which of the following will NEVER result in bifurcation of an embedded derivative, provided there are no other conditions requiring bifurcation?
body.instruction: Check the correct option and select Submit.

choice.cdata-section: The embedded derivative has all three characteristics of a derivative.
The host contract is accounted for at amortized cost.
The embedded derivative is closely related to the host instrument.
The host contract is expected to mature within one year.

body.question: Which of the following embedded derivatives are “closely related” to a debt instrument issued by A Corp.?
body.instruction: Check the correct option and select Submit.

choice.cdata-section: Option to purchase shares of C Corp
Interest rate escalation clause with a multiplier
Interest payments indexed to the credit risk of A Corp. based on a predefined formula
Principal payments indexed to stock price of C Corp

body.question: Which of the following contracts entered into by an entity is an example of a derivative in IFRS 9?
body.instruction: Check the correct option and select Submit.

choice.cdata-section: A loan commitment to grant a loan to another party at a future date at below market rates.
A financial guarantee held to receive a payment reimbursing for the loss due to a customer non-payment.
A forward contract to purchase shares of a private entity at a future date, with zero initial investment.
An investment in a public company with significant fluctuations in its market capitalization.

body.question:
An entity enters into a contract to purchase sugar from a supplier. The entity will pay a fixed amount in US dollars at a future date on delivery of the goods.
Which of the following should the entity consider when determining if the embedded foreign currency derivative is separated from the host contract?
body.instruction: Check the correct option and select Submit.

choice.cdata-section: If the host contract relates to the purchase of a commodity
If the entity can settle the contract via the market mechanism
If the foreign currency exchange rate fluctuates significantly
If the payments are denominated in a functional currency of either party of the contract

body.question: Which of the following is an example of a contract that is exempt from derivative accounting and can be accounted for as an executory contract?
body.instruction: Check the correct option and select Submit.

choice.cdata-section: A forward contract to purchase 5,000 tons of steel to be used in production
A forward contract to purchase 100 shares of a public entity at a set price
A forward contract denominated in a foreign currency to purchase 5 tons of coffee beans
A forward contract to sell 2 million bushels of corn

body.question: Under IFRS, when is reassessment of an embedded derivative performed?
body.instruction: Check the correct option and select Submit.

choice.cdata-section: When there are changes in market conditions
When there is a revision to the contract terms that cause a significant modification to the cash flows under the contract
Throughout the life of the contract
At the time annual financial statements are prepared

body.question: Which statement regarding the requirements for reassessment of embedded derivatives under IFRS is correct?
body.instruction: Check the correct option and select Submit.

choice.cdata-section: IFRS requires reassessment of embedded derivatives throughout the life of the contract.
IFRS requires reassessment of embedded derivatives at least quarterly for non-public entities and at least monthly for public entities.
IFRS requires reassessment of embedded derivatives quarterly regardless of whether the entity is subject to interim reporting.
IFRS requires reassessment of embedded derivatives when the changes in the terms of the contract significantly modify the cash flows under the contract.

body.question: When should entities assess whether embedded derivatives require separation from the host contract?
body.instruction: Check the correct option and select Submit.

choice.cdata-section: When the entity first becomes a party to the contract
When the entity chooses to in accordance with its documented policy
When the entity prepares its quarterly financial statements
When the entity derecognizes the host contract

header.title: Your Opinion Matters
header.textContent: Share your input to help enhance KPMG Executive Education course offerings.

questions.question: Nulla lobortis porta rutrum. Donec pretium a ligula at auctor. Mauris molestie mollis libero, id consectetur leo tristique quis?

Mauris imperdiet erat eu imperdiet consequat.

options.text: Morbi vitae enim sed massa suscipit convallis vel sit amet turpis.
Phasellus volutpat turpis porta sollicitudin interdum.
Suspendisse commodo nulla ut maximus sagittis.
Sed id sem ut justo mollis pretium eu id urna.

surveyData.messageText: Thank you! Select Submit to proceed.
